description: This table contains all non-coding mutations from the current release.

fields.name: Sample_name
fields.description: A sample is an instance of a portion of a tumour being examined for mutations. The sample name can be derived from a number of sources. In many cases it originates from the cell line name. Other sources include names assigned by the annotators, or an incremented number assigned during an anonymisation process. A number of samples can be taken from a single tumour and a number of tumours can be obtained from one individual. A sample id is used to identify a sample within the COSMIC database. There can be multiple ids, if the same sample has been entered into the database multiple times from different papers.

fields.name: ID_SAMPLE
fields.description: (See description for Sample_name field)

fields.name: ID_tumour
fields.description: (See description for Sample_name field)

fields.name: Primary_site
fields.description: The primary tissue/cancer from which the sample originated. More details on the tissue classification are avaliable from http://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cell_lines/classification.  In COSMIC we have standard classification system for tissue types and sub types because they vary a lot between different papers.

fields.name: Site_subtype_1
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 1) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Site_subtype_2
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 2) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Site_subtype_3
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 3) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Primary_histology
fields.description: The histological classification of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_1
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 1) of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_2
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 2) of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_3
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 3) of the sample.

fields.name: GENOMIC_MUTATION_ID
fields.description: Unique mutation identifier

fields.name: LEGACY_MUTATION_ID
fields.description: Unique mutation identifier

fields.name: zygosity
fields.description: Information on whether the mutation was reported to be homozygous , heterozygous or unknown within the sample.

fields.name: GRCh
fields.description: Coordinate system used

fields.name: genome_position
fields.description: Genomic coordinate of the mutation

fields.name: Mutation_somatic_status
fields.description: Information on whether the sample was reported to be Confirmed Somatic, Previously Reported or Variant of unknown origin.

fields.name: WT_SEQ
fields.description: Wild type sequence

fields.name: MUT_SEQ
fields.description: Mutated sequence

fields.name: SNP
fields.description: All the known SNPs are flagged as 'y' defined by the 1000 genomes project, dbSNP and a panel of 378 normal (non-cancer) samples from Sanger CGP sequencing.

fields.name: FATHMM_MKL_NON_CODING_SCORE
fields.description: FATHMM-MKL non-coding score. A p-value ranging from 0 to 1 where >= 0.7 is functionally significant.

fields.name: FATHMM_MKL_NON_CODING_GROUPS
fields.description: FATHMM-MKL group classification. More details from http://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/analyses.

fields.name: FATHMM_MKL_CODING_SCORE
fields.description: FATHMM-MKL coding score (p-value ranging from 0 to 1).

fields.name: FATHMM_MKL_CODING_GROUPS
fields.description: FATHMM-MKL group classification (coding). More details from http://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/analyses.

fields.name: Whole_Genome_Reseq
fields.description: If the enitre genome is sequenced

fields.name: Whole_Exome
fields.description: If the enitre exome is sequenced

fields.name: ID_STUDY
fields.description: Lists the unique Ids of studies that have involved this non coding mutation.

fields.name: PUBMED_PMID
fields.description: The PUBMED ID for the paper that the sample was noted in.

fields.name: HGVSG
fields.description: Human Genome Variation Society genomic syntax (3' shifted).
